snippet: The TouchPad tablet from Hewlett-Packard was one of the most closely watched new gadgets of 2011 - and quickly turned out to be the year's biggest flop, reports Brian X. Chen in Monday's New York Times. Analysts point to several factors, but some...
abstract: The TouchPad tablet from Hewlett-Packard was one of the most closely watched new gadgets of 2011 - and quickly turned out to be the year's biggest flop, reports Brian X. Chen in Monday's New York Times. Analysts point to several factors, but some people involved in creating the tablet point to problems with its core software.

headline.main: In Flop of H.P. TouchPad, an Object Lesson for the Tech Sector
